Dating: 26TH DYNASTY (not before); LATE PERIOD; GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Alabastron
Description: Elongated alabastra vase, short neck and ring shaped rim. The body has thin and almost transparent walls. Its instable base increases the piece slenderness. On top the body there are two rectangular handles. The vase was used to keep ointments or perfumes.
